definition[0]: to push something, especially the edge of a piece of cloth or paper, into or behind something so that it looks tidier or stays in place
example[0]: She tucked an unruly lock of hair behind her ear.
definition[1]: to put something into a small space, especially in order to protect, hide, carry, or hold it
example[2]: Giles was tucking his pile of books under his arm.
example[3]: He took the glasses off and tucked them in his pocket.
definition[2]: to put a tuck (=special fold) in a piece of clothing
definition[3]: a narrow flat fold of cloth sewn into a piece of clothing for decoration or to give it a special shape
definition[4]: a small medical operation done to make your face or stomach look flatter and younger
definition[5]: cakes, sweets etc â€“ used especially by schoolchildren
